comments.raw_text:
I can see this issue in Firefox 8, haven't tested Nightly.

STR:
1. Load an image in a new tab: http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/1/14/Animated_PNG_example_bouncing_beach_ball.png

2. Select the image by pressing Ctrl+A

3. Right-click on it, and notice that there are 'open link in new tab', 'open link in new window' and 'open link' items present.

I would say that technically, an image is not a link and thus shouldn't trigger these context menu items.
